The operational hours of the ARO in local time are..

Reference GSPRM Aberdeen Airport Chart 10-9 (or image)
Which of the following statements is incorrect?
1.  The airport reference point coodinates are N57°12.2´ W002°11.9´
2.  The centreline of runway 23 is 229° T
3.  The threshold elevation of RW 34 is 215 ft
4.  Aberdeen Ground frequency is 121.7 MHz (part time operation)

Refer to GSPRM  LEAL ALICANTE SPAIN STAR 10-2B or image. What is the IAF for aircraft arriving for Rwy 28?
During the planning phase for a sector, ACTUAL and FORECAST weather at the destination and alternate aerodromes will normally be considered for the period:

Refer to the image.
The image shows an extract of the route information page on a typical operational flight plan produced by a flight planning tool for two flights, EASA14 and EASA26.
The flights are with the same aeroplane type on the same day and time and have the same wind component of + 23 kt. However, for EASA14 the difference between AIR DIST and GND DIST is 46 NM and for EASA26 the difference between AIR DIST and GND DIST is 83 NM.
Choose the correct statement.

options.text: Although the AVG W/V is the same, EASA26 has a longer flight time, which therefore creates a greater difference between AIR DIST and GND DIST.
There is an error in the flight planning tool as an identical AVG W/V should create an identical difference between AIR DIST and GND DIST.
Both flights have identical TAS but EASA14 flies at a higher GS, which therefore creates a smaller difference between AIR DIST and GND DIST.
The difference between TAS and the GS is smaller for EASA14, which therefore creates a smaller diffference between AIR DIST and GND DIST.

taxiway C was available 60 minutes prior to night.
taxiway closures did not affect VFR traffic.
taxiways CD and CL were closed as well.

Given the following NOTAM, are you able to fly passengers into EUAD on a charter flight?

Q EGTT/QAZCA/IV/NBO/AE/000/022/5334N00021W003 A EUAD B FROM: 15/12/08 09:42 C TO: PERM E AERODROME ATZ ACTIVE 0620-2115 DAILY. AD OPEN, ATS AVBL, USE OF THE AD IS PRIOR PERMISSION REQUIRED 0620-0630 UTC FOR NON SKED MOVEMENTS. EUAD AD 2.3 AND AD 2.17 REFER

options.text: Yes, you can fly in at any time after 06:30 UTC, PPR from flights between 06:20 and 06:30 UTC.
Yes, you can fly in at any time between 06:20-21:15 UTC daily.
Yes, but you must file a flight plan before departing, at least two hours before the scheduled arrival time.
Yes, but you need prior permission between 06:20-21:15.

variant.question:
Below is an extract for a NOTAM for an airfield:
B) FROM: 13/10/01 07:00C) TO: 13/10/20 16:00
E) CRANE OPR 020 DEG TRUE, 660M FM ARP MAX JIB HEIGHT 96 FT AGL.
SCHEDULE: 0700-1600
In relation to this NOTAM, which of the following statements is completely correct?

options.text: From 1st October to 20th October, crane operating at a position on a bearing of 020° true and distance 660 metres from the aerodrome reference point, between 0700 – 1600 UTC, max jib height 96 ft above ground level.
On 13th October, crane operating at a position on a bearing of 020°true and distance 660 metres from the active runway point, between 0700 – 1600 UTC, max jib height 96ft above ground level.

From 1st October to 20th October, crane operating at a position on a bearing of 020°true and up to 660 metres from the average recorded position, between 0700 – 1600 UTC, max jib height 96 ft above mean sea level.

From 1st October to 20th October, crane operating at a position on a bearing of 020°true and distance 660 metres from the aerodrome reference point, between 1700 – 0600 UTC, max jib height 96 ft above ground level.
